ovdesc.p: The table is used to capture Transaction codes for Provision accounting.

desc.p: Specifies the transaction code to be used for the Debit entries generated for provisioning.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must be a valid transaction code on the TRANSACTION table.
Code must be not defined as a CREDIT type on the TRANSACTION table.
Specifies the transaction code to be used for the Credit entries generated for provisioning.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must be a valid transaction code on the TRANSACTION table.
Code must be not defined as a DEBIT type on the TRANSACTION table.
SYSTEM is the only valid ID.
Specifies the transaction code to be used for the Write-back Credit entries generated during Provisioning.
Write-backs occur when the last provisioned amount is greater than the Current provision amount. Hence the difference amount is Debited to Internal account and Credited back to PL.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must be a valid transaction code on the TRANSACTION table.
Code must be not defined as a DEBIT type on the TRANSACTION table.
Specifies the transaction code to be used for the Write-back Debit entries generated during Provisioning.
Write-backs occur when the last provisioned amount is greater than the Current provision amount. Hence the difference amount is Debited to Internal account and Credited back to PL.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must be a valid transaction code on the TRANSACTION table.
Code must be not defined as a CREDIT type on the TRANSACTION table.
